measured_by: single-item 7-point Likert scale question (‘How healthy is this food product?’)
justification: “respondents were presented with a set of 43 common food products and asked ‘How healthy is this food product?’ Responses for each product were given on a seven-point Likert scale (1 = very unhealthy; 7 = very healthy).”

measured_by: 7-point Likert scale (1 = very little fat, 7 = very much fat)
justification: “for ‘fat content,’ the scale ranged from 1 = very little to 7 = very much.”
construct: Perceived fat content of a food product

measured_by: 7-point Likert scale (1 = low level of processing, 7 = high level of processing)
justification: “for ‘level of processing,’ it ranged from 1 = low level of processing to 7 = high level of processing.”

measured_by: 7-point Likert scale (anchors labelled ‘very few’ to ‘very many’ artificial additives)
justification: “the characteristics were … artificial additives … Respondents rated each … on a seven-point Likert scale, with labels differing slightly depending on the characteristic.”

measured_by: 7-point Likert scale (1 = very few vitamins, 7 = very many vitamins)
justification: The 17 characteristics rated included “vitamin content,” each “on a seven-point Likert scale,” indicating that vitamin content perceptions were measured by this scale.
